newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan stocks hit seventh straight record.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan stocks hit seventh straight record.

text.p: Caracas stocks rose to record highs for the seventh consecutive day in a mixed session that saw late foreign bidding outweigh a morning bout of profit- taking, traders said.

The market's 19-share index rose 0.58 percent to close at 5,481.90 points, according to preliminary figures from the stock exchange. Turnover fell back to more modest levels after last week's performance as 20 million shares traded worth 2.9 billion bolivars ($6 million).
The index's rise was boosted by strong afternoon gains in market leader Electricidad de Caracas, traders said.
